And this will be an introductory lesson message, if you will. And each year, the Lord has given me the opportunity and privilege to serve as the pastor here at Fellowship Baptist Church. I have sought Him with regard to an annual theme. It helps me and I believe it helps our church to have an annual theme. And there've been many years that the annual theme has been from a particular book of the Bible, as was the case last year. There've been other years that will be more like this year where it's more of a topical theme and great is the Lord will be a topical theme. So the first year that we had a church theme was in 2012. And we had as our theme that year, standing on His promises. And I'm so thankful for the promises of God's word. And of course, that was a topical series where we looked at just a number of promises that are throughout the word of God and how we can rejoice in them. They're exceeding great and precious promises. In 2013, I preached from the book of Esther. Our theme was for such a time as this. And what a relevant truth from the Old Testament book of Esther and God would still use us. And we're so thankful that He used Esther and He would use us. In 2014 was the book of John, he must increase. And what a joy to be reminded of that truth in John three, where John the Baptist said he must increase, I must decrease. And we worked throughout the book of John there in 2014. In 2015 and 2016, I preached to the book of Acts. Lord, I pray for every child of God that we'd have a renewed view of just how great You are, that we'd have a determined commitment to declare Your greatness, to praise You for who You are, to talk by glorious power, by mighty acts. Lord, I pray that in these moments of invitation, as we have opportunity to respond to how Your Spirit has spoken to us through Your Word, I pray, God, that decisions would be made that would endure, that would cause us to be conformed to the image of Christ to impact eternity. Move and work as only You can, and we'll give You the honor and glory for it's in Christ's name we pray.

segments.text: this morning, we're just looking at the first two verses,
the verses that we sang this morning for our theme song
and the song that, the psalm that is the, of course,
source of our theme for this year.
And this will be an introductory lesson message,
if you will.
And each year, the Lord has given me the opportunity
and privilege to serve as the pastor here
at Fellowship Baptist Church.
I have sought Him with regard to an annual theme.
It helps me and I believe it helps our church
to have an annual theme.
And there've been many years that the annual theme
has been from a particular book of the Bible,
as was the case last year.
And walking in the light and I preached through
the book of 1 John on Sunday mornings
and went through the entire book.
There've been other years that will be more like this year
where it's more of a topical theme
and great is the Lord will be a topical theme.
I won't spend the entire year in Psalm 48
and there will be more of a topical theme
throughout the year with various messages.
I'll get into some of that here in just a moment,
but let me just quickly review for you.
In 2012, I came here in 2011,
the Lord brought us in August of 2011.
So the first year that we had a church theme was in 2012.
And we had as our theme that year,
standing on His promises.
And I'm so thankful for the promises of God's word.
And of course, that was a topical series
where we looked at just a number of promises
that are throughout the word of God
and how we can rejoice in them.
They're exceeding great and precious promises.
In 2013, I preached from the book of Esther.
Our theme was for such a time as this.
And what a relevant truth from the Old Testament
book of Esther and God would still use us.
And we're so thankful that He used Esther
and He would use us.
In 2014 was the book of John, he must increase.
And what a joy to be reminded of that truth in John three,
where John the Baptist said he must increase,
I must decrease.
And we worked throughout the book of John there in 2014.
In 2015 and 2016, I preached to the book of Acts.
And 2015 was the first half of the book,
the first 12 chapters,
and it was boldness to speak thy word.
And how we see the early church moving and working
and following the Lord and they had faced persecution
and threat and they prayed,
not that God would remove the persecution,
not that God would punish the persecutors,
but they prayed that God would grant them boldness
to speak His word.
And what a great prayer.
And we see that God answered that prayer
and God gave them boldness and God used them mightily.
The Bible says that they filled Jerusalem
with their doctrine.
The Bible says that they turned the world upside down
and what a blessing to see the word of God spread.
And then in 2016, we finished the book of Acts
chapters 13 through 28 and dealt with the statement
that Paul made in Acts 27.
I believe God and how important it is
that we have faith in God,
that we believe what God says
in the midst of that great storm
and all that was taking place

and moon for days and all hope was gone.

and Paul stands up with great confidence
and says, I believe God,
that it's going to be just as He said it's going to be
and what a blessing to see the faith

2017, increase our faith.

we dealt with as we study the word of God,
what in God's word increases our faith?

In 2018, count your blessings.
